eys3d.depthFilter package¶

Submodules¶

eys3d.depthFilter.depthFilter module¶

class eys3d.depthFilter.depthFilter.DepthFilterOptions(camera_device)

Bases: object

Filter type apply to the depthfilter.

It includes: subsample, edgePreServingFilter, holeFill, temporalFilter and removeCurve sub function. Please see each sub function comment for detail usage.

Parameters

camera_device (obj) – CameraDevice.

disable()

Disable DepthFilter function.

To disable DepthFilter function.

enable()

Enable DepthFilter function.

To enable DepthFilter function.

get_bytes_per_pixel()

Get the number of bytes per pixel.

To get the number of bytes for one pixel.

Returns

The number of bytes for saving one pixel.

Return type

int

is_enabled()

Check the depthFilter status.

To check the status of depth filtering function.

Returns

True for enable. False otherwise.

Return type

bool

eys3d.depthFilter.edgePreServingFilter module¶

class eys3d.depthFilter.edgePreServingFilter.EdgePreServingFilter(camera_device, depthFilterOptions)

Bases: object

Perform edge preserve filtering.

This function can smooth the depth image but still reserve the edge information. User can strengthen the effect by increasing the parameter “level”.

disable()

Disable edge preserve filtering.

To disable edge preserve filtering.

enable()

Enable edge preserve filtering.

To enable edge preserve filtering.

get()

Get the config of the edge preserve filtering to a dictionary.

To get all the argument about edge preserve filtering. It returns a dictionary.

Returns

The dictionary with following keys:

level (int): The level for edge preserve filtering (larger means heavier effect). sigma (str): The internal parameter for edge preserve filtering. Default is 0.015. Lambda (str): The internal parameter for edge preserve filtering. Default is 0.1 .

Return type

dict

get_edge_level()

Get the level.

To get the level of the edge preserve filtering.

Returns

The level for edge preserve filtering.

Return type

int

get_lambda()

Get the lambda.

To get the lambda user provided. This value is fixed.

float: The internal parameter for edge preserve filtering.

get_sigma()

Get the sigma.

To get the sigma value. This value is fixed.

Returns

The internal parameter for edge preserve filtering.

Return type

float

is_enabled()

Check the status.

To check the status of edge preserve filtering function.

Returns

True for enable. False otherwise.

Return type

bool

set(edge_level)

Set the config fo the edge preserving filtering.

To set all the argument about edge preserve filtering.

Parameters

level (int) – The level for edge preserve filtering (larger means heavier effect).

set_edge_level(level)

Set the level of edge.

To set the level for edge preserve filtering.

Parameters

level (int) – The level for edge preserve filtering (larger means heavier effect). The range is 1 ~ 10.

eys3d.depthFilter.holeFill module¶

class eys3d.depthFilter.holeFill.HoleFill(camera_device, depthFilterOptions)

Bases: object

Performe HoleFill.

This function tries to fill the holes in the depth image. Users can strengthen the effect by increasing the parameter “level”. The parameter “horizontal” controls the hole filtering to be performed horizontally or vertically.

Parameters

  • camera_device (obj) – CameraDevice.

  • depthFilterOptions (obj) – DepthFilterOptions.

disable()

Disable holeFill.

To disable holeFill.

disable_horizontal()

Disable horizontal.

To disable horizontal hole filiing.

enable()

Enable holeFill.

To enable holeFill.

enable_horizontal()

Enable horizontal.

To enable horizontal hole filiing.

get()

Get the config of the hole filiing to a dictionary.

To get the total argument about hole filling. It return a dictionary.

Returns

The dictionary with following keys: kernel_size (int): The kernel size for hole filtering. Defalut is 1. level (int): The level for hole filling. The larger one means heavier effect.

Return type

dict

get_kernel_size()

Get the kernel size.

To get the kernel size user provided.

Returns

The kernel size for hole filtering.

Return type

int

get_level()

Get the level.

To get the level for hole filling.

Returns

The level for hole filling.

Return type

int

is_enabled()

Check the status.

To check the status of subsample function.

Returns

True for enable. False otherwise.

Return type

bool

is_horizontal()

Check the status of horizontal.

To check the status of horizontal.

Returns

True for enable. False otherwise.

Return type

bool

set(kernel_size, level)

Set the config of the hole filling.

To set the total argument about hole filling.

Parameters

  • size (int) – The kernel size for hole filtering. Defalut is 1.

  • level (int) – The level for hole filling. The larger one means heavier effect.

set_kernel_size(size=1)

Set the kernel size.

To set the kernel size for hole filtering.

Parameters

size (int) – The kernel size for hole filtering. Defalut is 1.

set_level(level)

Set the level.

To set the level for hole filling.

Parameters

level (int) – The level for hole filling. The larger one means heavier effect. The range is 1 ~ 3.

eys3d.depthFilter.subsample module¶

class eys3d.depthFilter.subsample.Subsample(camera_device, depthFilterOptions)

Bases: object

Perform subsampling process.

This function mainly scales the depth image down to reduce the computational loading. It provides users two kinds of filtering methods (median and mean filtering) to subsample the depth image. Furthermore, this function should be used with “EtronDI_ApplyFilters”. Then, you have to call “EtronDI_ApplyFilters” before finishing the process of depth filtering, if you have called this function at the beginning of the process of depth filtering.

Parameters

  • camera_device (obj) – CameraDevice.

  • depthFilterOptions (obj) – DepthFilterOptions.

disable()

Disable subsample.

To disable subsample.

enable()

Enable subsample.

To enable subsample.

get()

Get the filtering mode and scaling factor to a dictionary.

To get the filtering mode and scaling factor. It return a dictionary.

Returns

The dictionary with following keys:

mode_index (int): The filtering mode. 0: median filter. 1: mean filter. factor (int): The scaling factor.

Return type

dict

is_enabled()

Check the status.

To check the status of subsample function.

Returns

True for enable. False otherwise.

Return type

bool

set(mode_index)

Set the filtering mode and scaling factor.

To set the filtering mode and scaling factor.

Parameters

mode_index (int) – The mode for subsample. 0: median filter and factor 2. 1: median filter and factor 3. 2: mean filter and factor 4. 3: mean filter and factor 5.

eys3d.depthFilter.temporalFilter module¶

class eys3d.depthFilter.temporalFilter.TemporalFilter(camera_device, depthFilterOptions)

Bases: object

Perform temporal filter.

This function can reduce the variation of each depth pixel by mixing the current depth image and the previous ones. Users can control the mixing ratio through the parameter “alpha”. Increasing it can strengthen the influence of the current depth image.

Parameters

  • camera_device (obj) – CameraDevice.

  • depthFilterOptions (obj) – DepthFilterOptions.

disable()

Disable temporal filter.

To disable temporal filter.

enable()

Enable temporal filter.

To enable temporal filter.

get()

Get the config of the temporal filtering to a dictionary.

To get all the total argument about temporal filtering. It returns a dictionary.

Returns

The dictionary with following keys:

alpha (str): The weighting ratio for controlling the mix of the current depthimage and the passing depth images. history (int): Number of passing depth images to be recorded.

Return type

dict

get_alpha()

Get the alpha.

To get the alpha user provided.

Returns

The alpha value.

Return type

float

get_history()

Get the history.

To get the history.

Returns

The number of passing depth images to be recorded.

Return type

int

is_enabled()

Check the status.

To check the status of temporal filtering function.

Returns

True for enable. False otherwise.

Return type

bool

set(alpha, history)

Set the config fo the temporal filtering.

To set all the argument about temporal filtering.

Parameters

  • alpha (float) – The weighting ratio for controlling the mix of the current depthimage and the passing depth images.

  • history (int) – Number of passing depth images to be recorded.

set_alpha(alpha)

Set the alpha.

To set the alpha the user could control the mixing raio.

Parameters

alpha (float) – The weighting ratio for controlling the mix of the current depthimage and the passing depth images. The range is 0 ~ 1.0.

set_history(history)

Set the history

To set the history value which is the number of passing depth images to be recorded.

Parameters

history (int) – Number of passing depth images to be recorded.The range is 2 ~ 3.
